question.text: The ploidy level is not the same in

solution.text: Double fertilization is a unique characteristic observed in the Angiosperm group of plants. In this, two fertilizations are observed - <math><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow></msup></math> between the female and male gametic cells forming zygote and <math><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></msup></math> is between the second male gamete and polar nuclei forming the primary endosperm nucleus. The ploidy of PEN is 3n (male gamete[1n] + polar nuclei[2n]). The polar nuclei are also called as secondary nucleus which is 2n. Endosperm (3n) and secondary nucleus do not have the same ploidy level.
